meanings.definition: A raised level surface on which people or things can stand.
meanings.sent1: The speaker stood on the platform to address the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The workers unloaded the boxes from the platform.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the platform was a perfect spot for a nap.
meanings.sent4: The platform of the stage symbolized equality among the performers.
meanings.sent5: The platform creaked under the weight of the heavy machinery.

meanings.definition: A declaration of the principles on which a group of persons stands.
meanings.sent1: The political party presented their platform to the voters.
meanings.sent2: The candidate's platform focused on education and healthcare.
meanings.sent3: The platform of the debate team was to always speak the truth.
meanings.sent4: The platform of unity brought the community together.
meanings.sent5: The platform outlined the goals and values of the organization.
